website_summaries.verdict: Kit provides some of the best audio quality that you'll find in a soundbar system, but the price tag is high.
pros: Includes 7 speakers and 3 tweeters in the soundbar
Wireless technology will work in multiple rooms
Offers 3 HDMI inputs to allow for connection of several devices
Can mount the hardware to the wall easily
cons: You'll pay quite a bit extra to have the type of audio quality this kit delivers

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working with less than a dozen uses
customer_reviews.text: The sound bar all of sudden would stay on the "Please Wait..." Message when it is turning on. It no longer works at all. Even though it was defective, Amazon did not return it. The Amazon manager in their returns department recommended I take it to a repair shop. Amazon doesn't take responsibility on defective items they sell for Sony. Save your money. Buy from Costco, their return policy on Sony defective products is way better.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Contreras

customer_reviews.title: voices crackle as if treble is super high and tinny
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely mediocre sound. Mid range is muddy as hell, voices crackle as if treble is super high and tinny, but there is no adjustment. Every show I watch I have to switch the sound type "Clear+, Movie, Movie2", because it is so inconsistent as to what sounds better. Distortion distortion distortion and weak bass. Worst sounding soundbar I have ever owned and I regret it. ** Yes I had it connected to internet and made sure running the latest software.
customer_reviews.author: MushyWaffle

customer_reviews.title: Screw Sony
customer_reviews.text: The 4k pass thru does not include HDR feature (which is almost impossible to find in the product specs or manual) so I essentially purchased a 7.1 stereo only to get 5.1 using ARC through my TV. No firmware update will be released because Sony wants you to buy their new products. Waste of money, waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Keltik

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Died just outside of warranty, sound distortion makes watching unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Beckett

customer_reviews.title: Pure Garbage
customer_reviews.text: 1000 bucks and this thing only lasted a week before I had to return it. Before buying this I would look up ht st9 stuck at please wait. Apparently this is a common problem with Sony soundbars.
customer_reviews.author: Tryan42

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Right after 12 months of using, the sound started getting distorted and the sub would cut in and out. At first I though it was the source and I replaced the TV and went direct. Nope. It’s the soundbar.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy this sound bar! I have had this bar for a little over 2 months and both outer speakers are blown. Attempting to contact customer service is useless as the do not respond! The subwoofer cuts in and out as it cannot maintain a stable RF frequency! I guess I will have to contact Amazon customer service to get this taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad option
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar gives a lot of problems has conectivity, to slow to response, has no support it all, i sugest strongly other model or brand bad sound for people who look a good one
customer_reviews.author: cesar meza

customer_reviews.title: The sound produced by this soundbar is fantastic! Take special care when configuring this unit with ...
customer_reviews.text: This Sony soundbar is feature riched.The sale price was main reason for purchasing this product.I was able to connect it to an older Sony Bravia TV using the Bravia Sync function with HDMI ARC connection.The sound produced by this soundbar is fantastic! Take special care when configuring this unit with other audio/video equipment.This soundbar is equipped with the newer hdmi 2.2 and hdcp copyright protection.Older a/v equipment may not work in the hdmi daisy chain connection.I am totally enjoying this home theater experience!
customer_reviews.author: Harvey G. Avery

customer_reviews.title: A great sound bar with 4k support but not hdr
customer_reviews.text: Such A good sound bar from the 7.1 channels to the subwoofer bass this is my first sound bar over 600$ and man i am impressed with the sound especially for gaming and even for movies it's nice. The only down side is it doesn't support hdr
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Gracia

customer_reviews.title: Does not come close to home surround system
customer_reviews.text: Does not match any way near original amp and speaker system . I have Bose surround. Just returned. Return was painless UPS came and picked up.
customer_reviews.author: magnolia

customer_reviews.title: and love the pass-through remote feature
customer_reviews.text: Some sync inconsistencies even when delay is set to zero (movement of lips vs sound coming from the speaker). Lacks full surround sound. On the plus side - sleek, loud, and love the pass-through remote feature.
customer_reviews.author: Myk A.

customer_reviews.title: dont buy
customer_reviews.text: the sound coming out was not what I expected! my factory Bose sound system in my car is much batter than this. for $800 and retail of $1500 I expect much more. also it kept resetting my xfinity cable box - 2-3 times a day. Sony tech support was always there but they could not help me I returned the unit- I hear the replacement sound bar is awesome but its $1300
customer_reviews.author: brian bedigian

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I am by no means an audiophile, but I have nothing but praises for the Sony HTST9 Sound Bar. I am able to hear sounds in movies, and games that I was unable to hear before on my old sound bar. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: John Do

customer_reviews.title: I love this speaker & sub combo! Great sound fills the room
customer_reviews.text: The sound bar sounds great with surround-sound! The sub woofer sounds excellent as well! My iPhone connects to the sound bar very easily with Bluetooth! I am extremely pleased with the Sony HTST9 7.1!
customer_reviews.author: SupaDave

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Sound.
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound quality. Easy to use and to adjust. Pairs nicely with the Sony 930D 4K Ultra 3D Smart TV.
customer_reviews.author: Starla Baker

customer_reviews.title: Soundbar was way better than most
customer_reviews.text: Soundbar was way better than most .Dialogue was pretty impressive. But I heard other sounds ( background sounds ) that I haven't heard in years ! Sub was good depending on audio grade of movie .Sometimes real good, other times not so good .
customer_reviews.author: julie keifrider

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Good while it lasted...left side SuperTweeter blew our after 4 months and Sony support is hell of a merry go around with people that have no idea. Asked me to ship the defective Sony product to their Service center at my own cost (heavy Soundbar) to Syracuse NY and they have no other service center in NJ or PA - told me doesn't matter if you are in Alaska or Hawaii , all go to Syracus, NY service center. Sony service Sucks !
customer_reviews.author: nkv2k

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found
customer_reviews.text: We use sound bars to improve the audio of our wall mounted Samsung TVs. We previously owned Bose sound bars (I'm a Bose fan too) and were underwhelmed by the sound clarity and dynamic range. A friend recommended this Sony Sound bar. It's clearly better than the Bose units we swapped out. Sony gives more clarity of speech, the sound fills the room better, the base is dramatic if you want it....or...the base can be reduced if you don't. There are lots of settings and options. We've replaced 2 Bose units with these Sonys and have one more to go.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Myers

customer_reviews.title: Bought one. It didn't work properly. Got replacement ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one. It didn't work properly. Got replacement, it didn't work either. Major voice volume changes during live shows and sports broadcasting. Tried all modes with no success. Decided to buy a Sonos and have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Bic

customer_reviews.title: Crapware! that Sony won't stand behind!
customer_reviews.text: Got the dreaded "please wait" issue shortly after connecting to an LG TV. Worked fine for 1 year connect to a Sony TV. After researching, even sending it to Sony's outsourced repair at my charge -- I wasn't going to pluck more down money with no guarantees. Generally have had good experience with Sony products, ever since their analog days. Sad to see they don't honor customer loyalty or stand by their (clearly defective!) product.
customer_reviews.author: disconcertia

customer_reviews.title: Pile of Junk
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Sony HTST9 sound bar to pair with our new LG OLED tv. What a mistake. Within one month, the sound started cutting out whenever the channel was changed or another device was used (ROKU, Blu-ray player) Tried Sony support-no help. Their solution-download the firmware fix. Tried switching cables, using Optical cable instead of HDMI, no luck. Got the Sony because of the ARC HDMI connection to the OLED ARC port and it seems that Sony ARC structure is as fault. Don't buy a Sony Sound bar. You will be wasting your money.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Avesian

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Surround sound it is not. That being said this is a major step up from TV audio. Supports hdmi ARC. I replaced a receiver fronts and center setup. I must say this is much cleaner, less wires, and easier to operate. HDMI control works great. Sound quality is acceptable but not what I would expect at this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Now it is pretty much useless
customer_reviews.text: Way too many software issues. Keeps getting stuck on Please Wait forever. Tried to update the firmware, but it gets stuck half way and shows an error. Now it is pretty much useless. Sony support is useless. $1,500 well wasted.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Big issue Wifi Conflict with sound bar.
customer_reviews.text: Great Sound Bar, Awesome Quality, fInishing. Looks good. Works great in movies , audio. Only issue is Conflicts wifi in the house. When sound bar is ON with Wireless sub woofer, , My wifi at home sucks. no way I can use Wifi at Home and this sound bar
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: Cracking sound after 6 mos
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at BB. It was great until 6 months later, the sound bar started to sound muffled and crackled when volume was low. Called Sony and they asked for me to ship it for repairs. However the sound is great and subwoofer works fine away from the TV. I wouldn't recommend this. As it is their most expensive sound bar. For the price, the quality sucks.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent soundbar to mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Love the sharp clear sound and surround, best soundbar if you need solution to limited space. Review update!! After only a short few months and hardly used, the center tweeter voice sound started to distort!!! Wow amazing how Sony sound bad at this price has this poor of quality!!! As I have read many comments it seems happening to many consumers!! SONY if you are reading this, you better do a major recall and fix everything or you will lose the speaker industry to kilpsch and Polk audio!! Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: G H

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, sounds great, but can't get audio in sync with video.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Sony customer for decades. I bought this sound bar with great expectations to set it along my XBR850C and I can't get the audio to sync with the video. There are settings for delaying audio, but my problem IS that the audio is already delayed. I've tried new top of the line hdmi cables and I still can't watch movies. I've already got the latest firmwares on both the sound bar and the TV, and still the same problem. Is mine defective or is this a problem with no solution?
customer_reviews.author: Jenaro Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Very Great DEAL at Half the price of the New HT-ST5000.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Sound and Price at this point, a $750 7.1-Channel Sound Bar. The Only Difference with SONY'S new HT-ST5000 is the lack of DOLBY ATMO feature for $750 Less. Some may be concerned that this HT-ST9, even though is 4K-compatible, does not pass through HDR Contents of the Video parts. If concerned about this, then you can connect your Video Source (Bluray player) to your 4K HDR TV directly, then connect between the TV and HT-ST9 Sound bar using the ARC HDMI Line (TV--IN and HT-ST9--OUT).
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Sony HTST9 is not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: This product has never worked from day one. I have sent it back to Sony 2 times for repairs. Now that the warranty is up it is not covered and it has broken again. This product has issues, do your research, their are reviews and web boards with lots of people who are having the same problem as me. Basically the unit turns on and says please wait but nothing ever happens. Save your self $1000 and go buy a different sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Layton

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great and works fine for me?
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the bad reviews. Mine has worked for >3 months with no issues. At first - I hung from TV mount. That was a mistake. Now on AV table and sounds fine. Hope I don't have issues - but so far so good...
customer_reviews.author: D. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, sounds great and looks great. Small downfall is sometimes goes to usb input when using arc hdmi
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: sounds good but too buggy!! Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds fabulous but had to return as the ARC and other HDMI inputs very glitchy. I will switch to an input like Apple TV etc and would constantly bring me back to TV no matter how many times you push the button. No amount of resetting, software updates resolve the issues. Do research on this soundbar and you will find many others with same problem. Unfortunately, I did my research too late.
customer_reviews.author: JC III

customer_reviews.title: 2 bad soundbars now
customer_reviews.text: On my second unit now. First was mailed back 3 times. Now 3 months into the new replacement soundbar it is dead again. No wifi. 5 minute start ups. Sony does not even care. Last Sony product I'll buy.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Post

customer_reviews.title: Best Soundbar, period.
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a Soundbar better than this, period. Also, this is much better than spending 1000-1200 odd on a amp + entry/mid level speaker system. Sound is crisp and clear. The powered Subwoofer has more than ample power, plus its wireless. Mounted mine under the TV and it is such a clean look. Replaced my 5.1 and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: KingS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and super easy setup. Song pal app needs some work. It's not very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Hagen

product_meta.title: Sony HTST9 7.1 Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer and HDMI cable
product_meta.description: Unbelievable, audio performance, capability, and convenience are yours with the HT-ST9. Delivering immersive 7.1 channel surround sound from 7 amplifiers and 9 speakers for true cinema-style performance. Enjoy solo or stream throughout your home with multi-room functionality. Google Cast ready, you can enjoy your favorite music apps, online radio stations, and podcasts.HDMI cable is included for the HTST9 7.1 Sound Bar Input Output Terminals: Analog Audio In (Inc TV CEC), Bluetooth Reception, Bluetooth Transmission, Ethernet, USB-A
feature_bullets: 800W 7.1 channel sound bar w/wireless subwoofer, HDMI with HDCP 2.2 to watch movies in brilliant 4K, Google Cast ready for easy streaming of your favorite music apps
Expand your listening with powerful multi-room capability, Enjoy immersive music and movie soundtrack playback, LDAC for an optimized Bluetooth audio streaming experience
Stream music from mobile devices w/Bluetooth & NFC connections, Stream audio from the bar to compatible Bluetooth headphones, Easy set up with 3 HDMI in/1 out and ARC support
HDMI cable is included for the HTST9 7.1 Sound Bar
